title: Peter Faith
author: Peter Faith
content: Why e be say for nija anything wey dey rampart especially for social media no dey genuine? How many of una Don receive the 25k conditional cash transfer? Scammers in Nigeria are opportunists, they create a clone of legitimate activities for their own benefits, its not only in Nigeria, scanning is everywhere, just that petty scams areÂ  plentiful here. This is why you must use your head when you're visiting any site and observe the following: do not visit a site that is not secured, if it doesn't have the padlock closed at the top left, its dangerous to engage in it Do Not click links directly from WhatsApp or any social media, just copy the link and goÂ  paste on your browser to avoidÂ  hacking your account do not be greedy, research properly about the authenticity of any program before engaging in it to ensure its originality  Do Not fill out your bank card details in a website, go for cash transfer instead unless you completely trust the site, but you can't trust things these days, can you? check for the site's trustÂ  rating on some scam detection websites like Web paranoid, URL VOID and a lot of them out there, its true it can't be 100% correct, but it surely helps.
